TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class InputStream : Java.Lang.Object, IDisposable, Java.IO.ICloseable
.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit InputStream extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.IO.ICloseable, class System.IDisposable

remarks.para: A readable source of bytes.
Most clients will use input streams that read data from the file system (), the network (/), or from an in-memory byte array ().
Use to adapt a byte stream like this one into a character stream.
Most clients should wrap their input stream with . Callers that do only bulk reads may omit buffering.

Some implementations support marking a position in the input stream and resetting back to this position later. Implementations that don't return false from and throw an when is called.
Subclassing InputStream Subclasses that decorate another input stream should consider subclassing , which delegates all calls to the source input stream.
All input stream subclasses should override both and . The three argument overload is necessary for bulk access to the data. This is much more efficient than byte-by-byte access.

The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int Available ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 Available() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an estimated number of bytes that can be read or skipped without blocking for more input.

remarks.para: Returns an estimated number of bytes that can be read or skipped without blocking for more input.
Note that this method provides such a weak guarantee that it is not very useful in practice.

Firstly, the guarantee is "without blocking for more input" rather than "without blocking": a read may still block waiting for I/O to completeÂ — the guarantee is merely that it won't have to wait indefinitely for data to be written. The result of this method should not be used as a license to do I/O on a thread that shouldn't be blocked.

Secondly, the result is a conservative estimate and may be significantly smaller than the actual number of bytes available. In particular, an implementation that always returns 0 would be correct. In general, callers should only use this method if they'd be satisfied with treating the result as a boolean yes or no answer to the question "is there definitely data ready?".
Thirdly, the fact that a given number of bytes is "available" does not guarantee that a read or skip will actually read or skip that many bytes: they may read or skip fewer.

It is particularly important to realize that you must not use this method to size a container and assume that you can read the entirety of the stream without needing to resize the container. Such callers should probably write everything they read to a and convert that to a byte array. Alternatively, if you're reading from a file, returns the current length of the file (though assuming the file's length can't change may be incorrect, reading a file is inherently racy).
The default implementation of this method in InputStream always returns 0. Subclasses should override this method if they are able to indicate the number of bytes available.

Docs.exception: if this stream is closed or an error occurs

remarks.para: Closes this stream. Concrete implementations of this class should free any resources during close. This implementation does nothing.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs while closing this stream.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Mark (int readlimit);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Mark(int32 readlimit) cil managed

Docs.param: the number of bytes that can be read from this stream before the mark is invalidated.
Docs.summary: Sets a mark position in this InputStream.

remarks.para: Sets a mark position in this InputStream. The parameter readlimit indicates how many bytes can be read before the mark is invalidated. Sending reset() will reposition the stream back to the marked position provided readLimit has not been surpassed.
This default implementation does nothing and concrete subclasses must provide their own implementation.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool MarkSupported() cil managed

Docs.summary: Indicates whether this stream supports the mark() and reset() methods.

remarks.para: Indicates whether this stream supports the mark() and reset() methods. The default implementation returns false.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract int Read ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 Read() cil managed

Docs.summary: Reads a single byte from this stream and returns it as an integer in the range from 0 to 255.

remarks.para: Reads a single byte from this stream and returns it as an integer in the range from 0 to 255. Returns -1 if the end of the stream has been reached. Blocks until one byte has been read, the end of the source stream is detected or an exception is thrown.

Docs.exception: if the stream is closed or another IOException occurs.

remarks.para: Equivalent to read(buffer, 0, buffer.length).

Docs.param: the initial position in buffer to store the bytes read from this stream.
the maximum number of bytes to store in b.
Docs.summary: Reads up to byteCount bytes from this stream and stores them in the byte array buffer starting at byteOffset.

remarks.para: Reads up to byteCount bytes from this stream and stores them in the byte array buffer starting at byteOffset. Returns the number of bytes actually read or -1 if the end of the stream has been reached.

Docs.exception: if the stream is closed or another IOException occurs.

public virtual void Reset ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Reset() cil managed

Docs.summary: Resets this stream to the last marked location.

remarks.para: Resets this stream to the last marked location. Throws an IOException if the number of bytes read since the mark has been set is greater than the limit provided to mark, or if no mark has been set.
This implementation always throws an IOException and concrete subclasses should provide the proper implementation.

Docs.exception: if this stream is closed or another IOException occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual long Skip (long n);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int64 Skip(int64 n) cil managed

Docs.summary: Skips at most byteCount bytes in this stream.

remarks.para: Skips at most byteCount bytes in this stream. The number of actual bytes skipped may be anywhere between 0 and byteCount. If byteCount is negative, this method does nothing and returns 0, but some subclasses may throw.
Note the "at most" in the description of this method: this method may choose to skip fewer bytes than requested. Callers should always check the return value.
This default implementation reads bytes into a temporary buffer. Concrete subclasses should provide their own implementation.

Docs.exception: if this stream is closed or another IOException occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
